title: 15e13 - Housing authority employees.
text:
The United States Housing
Act of 1937 and the Housing Act of 1949 require HUD to set and enforce
prevailing wage rates for architects, technical engineers, draftspersons, and
technicians employed in the development of a project. In addition, maintenance
laborers and mechanics employed by a local housing authority to perform routine
maintenance on property owned by the authority are subject to prevailing rates
established by HUD. Questions regarding such situations should be referred to
the appropriate HUD labor relations advisor. See
http://www.hud.gov/offices/olr/laborrelstf.cfm. However, if maintenance
laborers and mechanics employed by a housing authority are performing
construction work funded by one of the above-mentioned statutes, such work is
subject to prevailing wage standards of the DBRA (see FOH 15b06 and 15c00(c)).
